classes.point:
An entity to draw a spotlight. Will draw a beam when the player views it side on, and a halo when it's facing towards the player. Unless the 'No Dynamic Light' spawnflag is checked, it will also create a dynamic light wherever the end of the spotlight rests.This spotlight is entirely client side, it is not sync'd across clients. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'. The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode.
This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis.
The maximum rotation speed of the spotlight, in degrees per second. Length of the spotlight beam. Width of the spotlight beam. float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode. New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify ----- SPAWNFLAGS ----- TODO: get description from VDC TODO: get description from VDC ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: color, scale, spawnflags Removed: parentname, thinkfunction, vscripts TODO: identify changes

An env_sprite that only exists on the client (much lower overhead!) ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'. The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode. The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.
Rate at which the sprite should animate, if at all. Material of the sprite to be drawn. Scale multiplier of the sprite. Size of the glow to be rendered for visibility testing. Must be larger than the distance from the sprite center to empty space. So if this glow is inside geometry (like a light bulb), set this value to be bigger than the bulb's radius. Any time a sphere of this radius would be visible (poking through any nearby geometry), the glow will be rendered. float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode. This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, Yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, Roll is the rotation around the X axis. ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: angles, spawnflags Removed: parentname, thinkfunction, vscripts TODO: identify changes

An entity that spawns a particle system built using the particle editor. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis.

An entity that does nothing. Very useful as a positioning entity for other entities to refer to (i.e. the endpoint of an env_beam) ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis.
